 Where do you get the idea that Peter Parker is a dork? If you received that notation from the movie then you are not worthy to post such a post. Spiderman's fate was sealed when he was bitten by that spider, which means he will forever be Spiderman. Unlike Mister Batman, who -although doesn't directly buy his weapons- buys the material to make them, when Spiderman's powers are forever his. If Batman loses his utility belt, he becomes a bat with out its wings... fangs... or even sonar!
 
 I would rather rely on a super hero with ACTUAL SUPER powers, rather than a guy who needs a bat signal to tell him if there is danger.
jitobear
I'll take both with a side of Superman, please.
Mach

Let's get serious.
 
 Batman:
 -------
 
 Has a young man in a red mask as a side-kick, with an androgynous name "Robin"
 
 Uses a "utility belt" to fight crime.
 
 Has fake ears on his head covering.
 
 Completely natural..i.e. no superpowers other than perhaps super luck to be so physically, mentally, and financially capable.
 
 Face mask isn't adequate for a real disguise...everyone would know who he was if they dealt with both Bruce and Bat.
 
 Seems to work with the politicians.
 
 First series was corny and dorky...holy fireworks batman!!
 
 Spiderman:
 --------
 Great sense of humor
 
 Whips villans that are stronger and more financially capable than he is.
 
 Super-human strength, agility, senses, etc.
 
 granted, wears a body-suit, but it's head-toe, a real disguise.
 
 Is hated by the press
 
 Cool TV shows and cartoons, despite the era. Even the Electric Company "mute" spiderman was cool.
 
 
 Spidy is the man.
 
 -Mach
